image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr and Canberra Liberals Leader Elizabeth Lee stand together on a stage.

props.synopsis: In some Australian election campaigns the major parties can feel like two varieties of the same product, but at this election Canberrans have a choice before them that could shape the future of the capital for decades to come.

title.children: This election Canberrans face a choice that could shape the future of the capital for decades

image.altText: Leanne Castley, smiling, in front of a sports ground with The Canberra Hospital in the background.

props.synopsis: On the eve of the election, ACT Labor is found in breach of electoral laws for running advertisements that were "inaccurate and misleading" when criticising the shadow health minister's position on abortion.

title.children: ACT Labor forced to remove 'inaccurate and misleading' election ad

image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr and Canberra Liberals Leader Elizabeth Lee shake hands

props.synopsis: Just over half of the 213 policies that have been submitted for costing by the three biggest parties have been costed so far.

title.children: Here's what the ACT's major parties plan to spend if they're elected

image.altText: An aerial view of Lake Burley Griffin soon after filling up in 1964.

props.synopsis: It's played host to everything from nude swimmers and the Queen of England — not at the same time — to hot air balloons and giant Murray Cod. As Canberra marks 60 years since the inauguration of Lake Burley Griffin, let's take a look at how far it's come.

title.children: It's been 60 years since Lake Burley Griffin was first filled but it wasn't all smooth sailing

image.altText: Two older people disembark a plane.

props.synopsis: The visit will be a slimmed-down, five-day affair, taking into account the King's ongoing treatment for cancer. It is the first visit by a reigning monarch since 2011.

title.children: King Charles III and Queen Camilla have landed in Sydney. Here's what's planned for their royal visit

image.altText: NSW Police

props.synopsis: The officers were found to have not respected a 29-year-old Aboriginal man's right to silence, who was brought into custody in May 2020.

title.children: Police watchdog finds NSW officers engaged in 'serious misconduct' against vulnerable Aboriginal man in custody

image.altText: Lia Finocchiaro, Andrew Barr and Elizabeth Lee.

props.synopsis: Could the surprise devastation witnessed in the Northern Territory election a few months ago foreshadow a similar result in the ACT this weekend, or is the shared "territory" label where the similarities between the NT and the ACT end?

title.children: According to this expert, there is one key thing the Canberra Liberals need to do to unseat Labor

image.altText: a woman giving the finger at a man as he walks away

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Lee made the gesture towards a journalist at a press conference after the ACT Property Council's leaders' debate on Wednesday.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee makes rude gesture at journalist following tense press conference exchange

image.altText: A person reads a "how to vote" card at a temporary electronic voting booth at a polling place.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, ACT Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: ACT Votes 2024 — read, watch and listen to the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: A couple at a red carpet

props.synopsis: Cheryl Cole, the mother of Payne's 7-year-old son Bear said she was navigating an "earth shattering event" following the star's death in Buenos Aires.

title.children: Liam Payne's former partner and mother of his son lashes out at 'abhorrent reports and media exploitation'

image.altText: An aerial image of bushland with the faces of Greg Lynn, Carol Clay and Russell Hill on top.

props.synopsis: Sentencing is supposed to be the closing chapter of a criminal case but it's not for the families of Carol Clay and Russell Hill, who now await killer Greg Lynn's impending appeal.

title.children: The court gasped when convicted killer Greg Lynn was sentenced to 32 years for murdering Carol Clay, but the saga is not over

image.altText: A man with a dark beard wearing a checked shirt sitting in the front passenger seat of a car alongside another man.

props.synopsis: The death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar has left the group without a commander. Could his younger brother, who is now believed to be alive despite being declared dead in 2014, fill the gap?

title.children: Who is Mohammad Sinwar and could he become Hamas leader?

image.altText: Two older people disembark a plane.

props.synopsis: The visit will be a slimmed-down, five-day affair, taking into account the King's ongoing treatment for cancer. It is the first visit by a reigning monarch since 2011.

title.children: King Charles III and Queen Camilla have landed in Sydney. Here's what's planned for their royal visit

image.altText: A picture of Sydney Harbour with images of derelict boats and a barge in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Dozens of old, dilapidated commercial and private vessels have been left in bays across Sydney Harbour. A petition before NSW parliament is calling on the state government to clear the harbour of derelict vessels, crumbling structures, aging wharves and debris.

title.children: Rotting, derelict and dangerous: The abandoned vessels of Sydney Harbour

image.altText: A monitor lizard climbs a tree with a chunk of meat in its mouth.

props.synopsis: On an isolated island in the Federated States of Micronesia, community and invited scientists are attempting a world-first monitor lizard eradication program to protect nesting turtles.

title.children: A common painkiller is guarding this turtle haven from hordes of hungry lizards

image.altText: Valentino Guseli smiles

props.synopsis: Valentino Guseli is one of the brightest snowboarding stars on the planet. Already an Olympian and two-time World Cup winner, the laid-back 19-year-old has set his sights on his biggest challenge of all in the lead up to the 2026 Winter Games.

title.children: The teenage star ripping up the record books on the slopes of the Alps

image.altText: An older Solomon Islands woman staring down the barrel of the camera

props.synopsis: For the developing country, logging is a catch 22: It is the country's biggest export and a source of income for thousands, but it is causing irreversible environmental damage and a raft of social issues.

title.children: Logging marriages 'like instant coffee' in Solomon Islands, with girls 'sold' into relationships

image.altText: A graphic showing the Thales logo over a popping bottle of champagne and stacks of documents.

props.synopsis: A former defence official who allegedly handed confidential information to a weapons maker is still working for the French-owned business despite being at the centre of a formal referral to the corruption watchdog.

title.children: Corruption watchdog told defence to investigate former official who allegedly shared confidential information

image.altText: Donald Trump leans into the microphone as he speaks loudly behind a presidential lectern in front of the White House.

props.synopsis: There's a lot to learn about the coming weeks from Donald Trump's response to the 2020 election result.

title.children: Donald Trump still won’t admit he lost the 2020 election. Will he concede if he loses in 2024?

image.altText: A girl holds up a phone to take a selfie with a young man. She is holding a poster that says Students for Harris Waltz

props.synopsis: Whether he likes it or not, Jack Schlossberg is the heir to the Kennedy American political dynasty. But can we really blame 'nepo babies' for coming from a famous family?

title.children: Privilege, or a (Kennedy) curse? Jack Schlossberg and the rise of political 'nepo babies'

image.altText: Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow jumps to celebrate a try against Tonga.

props.synopsis: Australia's men's side takes down Tonga 18-0 after Jillaroos winger Julia Robinson scores a record six tries as Australia runs 17 past Papua New Guinea to kick off the Pacific Championships.

title.children: Kangaroos take down Tonga after Jillaroos' record-breaking 84-0 rout of PNG kicks off Pacific Championships

image.altText: A grey US B-2 stealth bomber attack aircraft seen flying through the rear entry of another military plane.

props.synopsis: The Department of Defence has confirmed Australia provided support for US strikes on October 17, targeting the Houthi facilities "through access and overflight for US aircraft in northern Australia".

title.children: Australian air bases helped with the major US strike on Houthi weapon stores

image.altText: Pills being counted by a pharmacist

props.synopsis: Steep costs have driven some Aussies to switch from brand-name medicine to its generic counterpart. Here's the price difference.

title.children: The cost of living has pushed Deenita to switch from brand-name medicines to generic. She saves $1,432 a year

image.altText: Hands hang out of a dark jail cell

props.synopsis: They tell stories of spending days in solitary confinement, being denied access to proper food and water, as well as prolonged physical and psychological torture, as part of an ongoing Senate inquiry.

title.children: After years spent 'less than human' in overseas detention, Australians share their stories of returning home

image.altText: Woman in radio studio with headphones and microphone on head.

props.synopsis: ABC veteran Fran Kelly demands more be done to tackle online misinformation and renew trust in media, while making the "bold prediction" that reports of radio broadcasting's decline are "greatly exaggerated".

title.children: Fran Kelly calls for fight against misinformation, says Australia should rekindle its love of radio

image.altText: Mike Pezzullo smiles while giving evidence to a parliamentary inquiry

props.synopsis: Mike Pezzullo's Order of Australia honour was stripped late last month after he was found to have breached the Australian public service code of conduct as home affairs department secretary.

title.children: Sacked home affairs boss says losing his Order of Australia 'does not amount to a hill of beans in this crazy world'

image.altText: Rosemarie Consignado smiles brightly as she takes a photo with the Federation University signboard in Ballarat, Victoria.

props.synopsis: As the federal government moves to cut back on international students in big cities, these students from India, Czechia and the Philippines reveal how they've embraced life at regional universities.

title.children: These international students are challenging perceptions about life at regional universities

image.altText: A ship pulls Taipan wreckage from the ocean, authorities are in a smaller watercraft nearby

props.synopsis: An inquiry into a helicopter crash off the north Queensland coast hears the ADF ignored safety concerns from test pilots about high-tech helmets before four aviators died in 2023.

title.children: 'I failed them': Retired test pilot apologises to families of ADF members killed in Taipan helicopter crash

image.altText: A sideshot of someone walking away from a camera

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton is met by angry protesters in Collie, one of seven places nationwide where a power station could be based under the Coalition's nuclear policy.

title.children: Angry protesters confront Peter Dutton in WA town over his plan to build nuclear power plant

image.altText: A number of people stand in a group, with one waving a Palestinian flag.

props.synopsis: Protesters have caused thousands of dollars in damage to federal MP electorate offices in New South Wales and Victoria.

title.children: Protesters cause nearly $90,000 in damage to Victorian MP's office

image.altText: Yahya Sinwar in a black suit, in front of a blurred background.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah vows to launch a new phase of fighting against invading Israeli troops a day after Israel said its forces in Gaza had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.

title.children: Yahya Sinwar's death to become 'a curse' for Israel, Hamas says

image.altText: Heavy rain floods highways and restaurants in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Severe thunderstorms have caused flash flooding across Victoria, cutting major roads and inundating some properties.

title.children: Major Melbourne roads flooded as storms sweep across the state

image.altText: Small round balls on a beach

props.synopsis: NSW Maritime says beaches that closed earlier this week when black spheres known as tar balls washed on shore are now safe to reopen, following health advice and a reduction in their quantity.

title.children: Sydney beaches to reopen this weekend following days of tar balls washing ashore

image.altText: A woman in a bike helmet with brown hair rides her bike in the country.

props.synopsis: Lisa Millar returns to her home town of Kilkivan to learn about its new rail trail and is reminded the decline of these small country towns doesn't have to be a permanent trend.

title.children: How do you give a dying town a second life? The answer for Lisa Millar's childhood home was a rail trail
